info.title: GA4GH Tool Discovery API
info.description: Proposed API for GA4GH (Global Alliance for Genomics & Health) tool repositories. A tool consists of a set of container images that are paired with a set of documents. Examples of documents include CWL (Common Workflow Language), WDL (Workflow Description Language), NFL (Nextflow), or GXFORMAT2 (Galaxy) that describe how to use those images and a set of specifications for those images (examples are Dockerfiles or Singularity recipes) that describe how to reproduce those images in the future. We use the following terminology, a "container image" describes a container as stored at rest on a filesystem, a "tool" describes one of the triples as described above. In practice, examples of "tools" include CWL CommandLineTools, CWL Workflows, WDL workflows, and Nextflow workflows that reference containers in formats such as Docker or Singularity.

tags.name: GA4GH
tags.description: A group of web resources proposed as a common standard for tool repositories

get.summary: List one specific tool, acts as an anchor for self references
get.description: This endpoint returns one specific tool (which has ToolVersions nested inside it).

404.description: The tool can not be found.

get.description: Returns all versions of the specified tool.

get.summary: List one specific tool version, acts as an anchor for self references
get.description: This endpoint returns one specific tool version.

404.description: The tool can not be found.

get.description: This endpoint returns all tools available or a filtered subset using metadata query parameters.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the tool, scoped to this registry, for example `123456`.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description:
Support for this parameter is optional for tool registries that support aliases.
If provided will only return entries with the given alias.

parameters.name: toolClass
parameters.description: Filter tools by the name of the subclass (#/definitions/ToolClass)

parameters.name: descriptorType
parameters.description: Filter tools by the name of the descriptor type

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: The image registry that contains the image.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization in the registry that published the image.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The author of the tool (TODO a thought occurs, are we assuming that the author of the CWL and the image are the same?).

200.description: An array of Tools that match the filter.

next_page.description: A URL that can be used to reach the next page based on the current offset and page record limit.

last_page.description: A URL that can be used to reach the last page based on the current page record limit.

self_link.description: A URL that can be used to return to the current page later.

current_offset.description: The current start index of the paging used for this result.

current_limit.description: The current page record limit used for this result.

get.summary: Get the tool descriptor for the specified tool
get.description: Returns the descriptor for the specified tool (examples include CWL, WDL, Nextflow, or Galaxy documents).

404.description: The tool descriptor can not be found.

get.summary: Get additional tool descriptor files relative to the main file
get.description: Descriptors can often include imports that refer to additional descriptors. This returns additional descriptors for the specified tool in the same or other directories that can be reached as a relative path. This endpoint can be useful for workflow engine implementations like cwltool to programmatically download all the descriptors for a tool and run it. This can optionally include other files described with FileWrappers such as test parameters and containerfiles.

parameters.name: relative_path
parameters.description: A relative path to the additional file (same directory or subdirectories), for example 'foo.cwl' would return a 'foo.cwl' from the same directory as the main descriptor. 'nestedDirectory/foo.cwl' would return the file  from a nested subdirectory.  Unencoded paths such 'sampleDirectory/foo.cwl' should also be allowed.

404.description: The tool can not be output in the specified type.

get.summary: Get a list of test JSONs
get.description: Get a list of test JSONs (these allow you to execute the tool successfully) suitable for use with this descriptor type.

404.description: The tool can not be output in the specified type.

get.summary: Get a list of objects that contain the relative path and file type
get.description: Get a list of objects that contain the relative path and file type. The descriptors are intended for use with the /tools/{id}/versions/{version_id}/{type}/descriptor/{relative_path} endpoint. Returns a zip file of all files when format=zip is specified.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The output type of the descriptor.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Returns a zip file of all files when format=zip is specified.

200.description: The array of File JSON responses.

404.description: The tool can not be output in the specified type.

get.summary: Get the container specification(s) for the specified image.
get.description: Returns the container specifications(s) for the specified image. For example, a CWL CommandlineTool can be associated with one specification for a container, a CWL Workflow can be associated with multiple specifications for containers.

404.description: There are no container specifications for this tool.

get.description: This endpoint returns all tool-classes available.

200.description: A list of potential tool classes.

externalDocs.description: Description of GA4GH Tool Registry (Exchange) Schema

version_id.name: version_id
version_id.description: An identifier of the tool version, scoped to this registry, for example `v1`. We recommend that versions use semantic versioning https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html  (For example, `1.0.0` instead of `develop`)

type.name: type
type.description: The output type of the descriptor. Plain types return the bare descriptor while the "non-plain" types return a descriptor wrapped with metadata.

id.name: id
id.description: A unique identifier of the tool, scoped to this registry, for example `123456`.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Amount of records to return in a given page.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Start index of paging. Pagination results can be based on numbers or other values chosen by the registry implementor (for example, SHA values). If this exceeds the current result set return an empty set.  If not specified in the request, this will start at the beginning of the results.

checksum.description: The hex-string encoded checksum for the data.

type.description:
The digest method used to create the checksum.
The value (e.g. `sha-256`) SHOULD be listed as `Hash Name String` in the https://github.com/ga4gh-discovery/ga4gh-checksum/blob/master/hash-alg.csv[GA4GH Checksum Hash Algorithm Registry].
Other values MAY be used, as long as implementors are aware of the issues discussed in https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6920#section-9.4[RFC6920].
GA4GH may provide more explicit guidance for use of non-IANA-registered algorithms in the future.

path.description: Relative path of the file.  A descriptor's path can be used with the GA4GH .../{type}/descriptor/{relative_path} endpoint.

ToolClass.description: Describes a class (type) of tool allowing us to categorize workflows, tasks, and maybe even other entities (such as services) separately.

id.description: The unique identifier for the class.

name.description: A short friendly name for the class.

description.description: A longer explanation of what this class is and what it can accomplish.

Tool.description: A tool (or described tool) is defined as a tuple of a descriptor file (which potentially consists of multiple files), a set of container images, and a set of instructions for creating those images.

url.description: The URL for this tool in this registry.

id.description: A unique identifier of the tool, scoped to this registry.

aliases.description:
Support for this parameter is optional for tool registries that support aliases.
A list of strings that can be used to identify this tool which could be  straight up URLs. 
This can be used to expose alternative ids (such as GUIDs) for a tool
for registries. Can be used to match tools across registries.

organization.description: The organization that published the image.

meta_version.description: The version of this tool in the registry. Iterates when fields like the description, author, etc. are updated.

has_checker.description: Whether this tool has a checker tool associated with it.

checker_url.description: Optional url to the checker tool that will exit successfully if this tool produced the expected result given test data.

versions.description: A list of versions for this tool.

ToolVersion.description: A tool version describes a particular iteration of a tool as described by a reference to a specific image and/or documents.

author.description: Contact information for the author of this version of the tool in the registry. (More complex authorship information is handled by the descriptor).

url.description: The URL for this tool version in this registry.

id.description: An identifier of the version of this tool for this particular tool registry.

is_production.description: This version of a tool is guaranteed to not change over time (for example, a  tool built from a tag in git as opposed to a branch). A production quality tool  is required to have a checksum

images.description: All known docker images (and versions/hashes) used by this tool. If the tool has to evaluate any of the docker images strings at runtime, those ones cannot be reported here.

descriptor_type.description: The type (or types) of descriptors available.

containerfile.description: Reports if this tool has a containerfile available. (For Docker-based tools, this would indicate the presence of a Dockerfile)

meta_version.description: The version of this tool version in the registry. Iterates when fields like the description, author, etc. are updated.

verified.description: Reports whether this tool has been verified by a specific organization or individual.

verified_source.description: Source of metadata that can support a verified tool, such as an email or URL.

signed.description: Reports whether this version of the tool has been signed.

included_apps.description: An array of IDs for the applications that are stored inside this tool.

registry_host.description: A docker registry or a URL to a Singularity registry. Used along with image_name to locate a specific image.

image_name.description: Used in conjunction with a registry_url if provided to locate images.

size.description: Size of the container in bytes.

updated.description: Last time the container was updated.

checksum.description: A production (immutable) tool version is required to have a hashcode. Not required otherwise, but might be useful to detect changes.  This exposes the hashcode for specific image versions to verify that the container version pulled is actually the version that was indexed by the registry.

ImageType.description: Indicates what kind of container is this image is.

DescriptorType.description: The type of descriptor that represents this version of the tool. Note that these files can also include associated Docker/container files  and test parameters that further describe a version of a tool.

DescriptorTypeWithPlain.description: The output type of the descriptor. Plain types return the raw text while the "non-plain" types return the application/json

FileWrapper.description:
A file provides content for one of
- A tool descriptor is a metadata document that describes one or more tools.
- A tool document that describes how to test with one or more sample test
JSON.
- A containerfile is a document that describes how to build a particular
container image. Examples include Dockerfiles for creating Docker images
and Singularity recipes for Singularity images

content.description: The content of the file itself. One of url or content is required.

checksum.description: A production (immutable) tool version is required to have a hashcode. Not required otherwise, but might be useful to detect changes.

url.description: Optional url to the underlying content, should include version information, and can include a git hash.  Note that this URL should resolve to the raw unwrapped content that would otherwise be available in content. One of url or content is required.
